required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Providing Expanded Continuous Labor Support to Pregnant Women in New Mexico With Substance Use Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Providing Expanded Continuous Labor Support to Pregnant Women in New Mexico With Substance Use Disorders

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine the feasibility of offering expanded continuous labor support by trauma- and addiction-trained medical paraprofessionals (i.e. doulas) at no cost to pregnant women receiving care for substance use disorders (SUD). The long-term goal of this transdisciplinary multilevel intervention is ultimately to reduce a major existing behavioral health disparity in the state. This cross-campus multi-disciplinary collaboration, is in partnership with Young Women United (a research and policy organization in NM) and doulas of the UNM Birth Companion Program. Through this partnership, women receiving combined OB/SUD treatment at the Milagro Program at UNMHSC will be offered expanded doula services.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who remain in the study
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants in the intervention arm who ask for the doula at delivery intake. Number of participants who complete the 2 week follow-up

secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with preterm, c-section, fetal demise, still birth, or other potentially adverse birth outcomes

other_outcome.measure: Percent drinking and substance use days
other_outcome.description: Using the timeline followback we will calculate average percentage of days of alcohol or other substance use for each group at birth and at 2 week follow-up.

other_outcome.time_frame: queries feelings during labor and birth but is administered at 2 week follow-up
other_outcome.description: Mother's Autonomy in Decision Making Questionnaire
Using a study specific form we will calculate the number of participants who attempted breastfeeding after the birth of the baby

other_outcome.time_frame: from birth through study completion, an average of 3 months
from birth through study completion, an average of 3 months
other_outcome.description: Average length of time that the infant remains hospitalized after the birth
Average score for social support on NIH toolbox
Study specific participant satisfaction - debriefing form - qualitative data.

arm_group.description: Participants will be assigned a doula.
Participants will not be assigned a doula.

intervention.description: Participants in the intervention condition will be assigned a doula who is a lay person trained to provide emotional and practical support to individuals throughout labor and delivery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- at least 18 years old
- able to participate in informed consent
- able to read, write, and speak English
- gestation of at least 26 weeks at baseline (necessary because of short duration of study)
- plan to give birth at UNM.
Exclusion Criteria:
- active psychosis
- current incarceration
- identified by medical staff as unable for medical reasons to currently participate in the study
- not interested in having doula support
